investmentIncomeData.c: From 6 April 2016 up to £5,000 of this dividend income is tax free. On amounts over £5,000 tax is payable at 7.5%, 32.5% or 38.1% depending on your tax band. Your tax code is adjusted to collect any additional tax due.
Savings interest from bank and building society accounts.

investmentIncomeData.a: Untaxed interest on savings and investments
investmentIncomeData.c: You are not taxed on savings and investments by your bank. Your tax code is adjusted so that you pay the tax due on this through PAYE.

otherIncomeData.c: The profit you made on the sale of UK property or land.
Income from other sources, such as self employment or renting out a room, that won’t be collected through your tax code.

The value of items given to you by your employer at no cost or less than market value. For example; a previous company car.

This is a payment made by your employer for using your own car to carry out your employer’s business.
